oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Opening Day at Sears, City Beautiful Scrapbooks, 24 Oct 1956, Vol. 2 p.76
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of Opening Day at Sears Department Store on 639 Lafayette Street. Taken by the City Beautiful Commission of Nashville, Tennessee, 1956. The City Beautiful Commission was established by the Mayor and City Council in June of 1953, for the purpose of improving the sanitation, cleanliness, and overall appearance of the City of Nashville. The commission later became a division of Metro Parks in 1975, and then the Metro Public Works division in 2005. Forms part of the City Beautiful Commission Scrapbook Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
